00049 /*****************************************************************************\
00050  *      File:   mi_sparc.c
00051  *      Author: Roland G. Ouellette, Wen-mei Hwu

00053  *      Modified : Roland G. Ouellette Mon Oct  8 14:33:41 1990
00054  *                 fixed negative lvar layout offsets.

00056  *                 By Sabrina Hwu, June, 1993 for adapting to new lcode format

00060 /*****************************************************************************\
00061  * NOTICE OF CONVENTION                                                      *
00062  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------- *
00063  * Mspec links to Pcode, Hcode, and Lcode modules.  In order to allow this   *
00064  * to take place without requiring front-end modules to link to liblcode.a,  *
00065  * Mspec code is divided into two classes as follows:                        *
00066  *  - mi_*.c must not depend on linkage to liblcode.a                        *
00067  *  - ml_*.c may depend on linkage to liblcode.a                             *
00068 \*****************************************************************************/
00069 
00070 /*===========================================================================
00071  *==========================================================================*/
00072 /* 10/29/02 REK Adding config.h */
00073 #include <config.h>
00074 #include <Lcode/l_main.h>
00075 #include <machine/m_spec.h>
00076 #include <machine/m_sparc.h>
00077 
00078 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00079 #define M_SPARC_SIZE_VOID       0
00080 #define M_SPARC_SIZE_BIT        1
00081 #define M_SPARC_SIZE_CHAR       8
00082 #define M_SPARC_SIZE_SHORT      16
00083 #define M_SPARC_SIZE_INT        32
00084 #define M_SPARC_SIZE_LONG       32
00085 #define M_SPARC_SIZE_FLOAT      32
00086 #define M_SPARC_SIZE_DOUBLE     64
00087 #define M_SPARC_SIZE_POINTER    32
00088 #define M_SPARC_SIZE_UNION      -1
00089 #define M_SPARC_SIZE_STRUCT     -1
00090 #define M_SPARC_SIZE_BLOCK      -1
00091 #define M_SPARC_SIZE_MAX        64
00092 
00093 #define M_SPARC_ALIGN_VOID      -1
00094 #define M_SPARC_ALIGN_BIT       1
00095 #define M_SPARC_ALIGN_CHAR      8
00096 #define M_SPARC_ALIGN_SHORT     16
00097 #define M_SPARC_ALIGN_INT       32
00098 #define M_SPARC_ALIGN_LONG      32
00099 #define M_SPARC_ALIGN_FLOAT     32
00100 #define M_SPARC_ALIGN_DOUBLE    64
00101 #define M_SPARC_ALIGN_POINTER   32
00102 #define M_SPARC_ALIGN_UNION     -1      /* depends on the field */
00103 #define M_SPARC_ALIGN_STRUCT    -1
00104 #define M_SPARC_ALIGN_BLOCK     -1
00105 #define M_SPARC_ALIGN_MAX       64
00106 
00107 int
00108 M_sparc_type_size (int mtype)
00109 {
00110   switch (mtype)
00111     {
00112     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00113       return M_SPARC_SIZE_VOID;
00114     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00115       return M_SPARC_SIZE_BIT;
00116     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00117       return M_SPARC_SIZE_BIT;
00118     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00119       return M_SPARC_SIZE_CHAR;
00120     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00121       return M_SPARC_SIZE_SHORT;
00122     case M_TYPE_INT:
00123       return M_SPARC_SIZE_INT;
00124     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00125       return M_SPARC_SIZE_LONG;
00126     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00127       return M_SPARC_SIZE_FLOAT;
00128     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00129       return M_SPARC_SIZE_DOUBLE;
00130     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00131       return M_SPARC_SIZE_POINTER;
00132     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00133       return M_SPARC_SIZE_UNION;
00134     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00135       return M_SPARC_SIZE_STRUCT;
00136     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00137       return M_SPARC_SIZE_BLOCK;
00138     default:
00139       return -1;
00140     }
00141 }
00142 int
00143 M_sparc_type_align (int mtype)
00144 {
00145   switch (mtype)
00146     {
00147     case M_TYPE_VOID:
00148       return M_SPARC_ALIGN_VOID;
00149     case M_TYPE_BIT_LONG:
00150       return M_SPARC_ALIGN_BIT;
00151     case M_TYPE_BIT_CHAR:
00152       return M_SPARC_ALIGN_BIT;
00153     case M_TYPE_CHAR:
00154       return M_SPARC_ALIGN_CHAR;
00155     case M_TYPE_SHORT:
00156       return M_SPARC_ALIGN_SHORT;
00157     case M_TYPE_INT:
00158       return M_SPARC_ALIGN_INT;
00159     case M_TYPE_LONG:
00160       return M_SPARC_ALIGN_LONG;
00161     case M_TYPE_FLOAT:
00162       return M_SPARC_ALIGN_FLOAT;
00163     case M_TYPE_DOUBLE:
00164       return M_SPARC_ALIGN_DOUBLE;
00165     case M_TYPE_POINTER:
00166       return M_SPARC_ALIGN_POINTER;
00167     case M_TYPE_UNION:
00168       return M_SPARC_ALIGN_UNION;
00169     case M_TYPE_STRUCT:
00170       return M_SPARC_ALIGN_STRUCT;
00171     case M_TYPE_BLOCK:
00172       return M_SPARC_ALIGN_BLOCK;
00173     default:
00174       return -1;
00175     }
00176 }
00177 
00178 /*
00179  *      The following functions are for documentation only.
00180  *      The function overhead is too great for actual usage.
00181  */
00182 void
00183 M_sparc_char (M_Type type, int unsign)
00184 {
00185   type->type = M_TYPE_CHAR;
00186   type->unsign = unsign;
00187   type->align = M_SPARC_ALIGN_CHAR;
00188   type->size = M_SPARC_SIZE_CHAR;
00189   type->nbits = M_SPARC_SIZE_CHAR;
00190 }
00191 
00192 void
00193 M_sparc_short (M_Type type, int unsign)
00194 {
00195   type->type = M_TYPE_SHORT;
00196   type->unsign = unsign;
00197   type->align = M_SPARC_ALIGN_SHORT;
00198   type->size = M_SPARC_SIZE_SHORT;
00199   type->nbits = M_SPARC_SIZE_SHORT;
00200 }
00201 
00202 void
00203 M_sparc_int (M_Type type, int unsign)
00204 {
00205   type->type = M_TYPE_INT;
00206   type->unsign = unsign;
00207   type->align = M_SPARC_ALIGN_INT;
00208   type->size = M_SPARC_SIZE_INT;
00209   type->nbits = M_SPARC_SIZE_INT;
00210 }
00211 
00212 void
00213 M_sparc_long (M_Type type, int unsign)
00214 {
00215   type->type = M_TYPE_LONG;
00216   type->unsign = unsign;
00217   type->align = M_SPARC_ALIGN_LONG;
00218   type->size = M_SPARC_SIZE_LONG;
00219   type->nbits = M_SPARC_SIZE_LONG;
00220 }
00221 
00222 /*--------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00223 int
00224 M_sparc_layout_order (void)
00225 {
00226   return M_BIG_ENDIAN;
00227 }
00228 
00229 void
00230 M_set_model_sparc (char *model_name)
00231 {
00232   if (!strcasecmp (model_name, "elc"))
00233     M_model = M_SPARC_ELC;
00234   else if (!strcasecmp (model_name, "viking"))
00235     M_model = M_SPARC_VIKING;
00236   else if (!strcasecmp (model_name, "ilp8"))
00237     M_model = M_SPARC_ILP8;
00238   else
00239     M_assert (0, "M_set_model_sparc:  Illegal model specified!");
00240 }
